form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Boxer (for herself, Mr. Sanders, and Mr. Markey) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 to prohibit certain waivers and exemptions from emergency preparedness and response and security regulations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safe and Secure Decommissioning Act of 2015.

section.header: Prohibition of certain waivers and exemptions
section.text: Chapter 19 of title I of the Atomic Energy Act of 1954 (42 U.S.C. 2015 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 276 the following:

section.header: Prohibition of certain waivers and exemptions

subparagraph.text: an emergency preparedness or response regulation or requirement; or
a security regulation or requirement applicable to spent nuclear fuel.

paragraph.text: The term licensee has the meaning given the term in section 50.2 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation).

subsection.header: Prohibition of certain waivers and exemptions
subsection.text: Subject to subsection (c), the Commission shall not approve the request of a licensee for a waiver of, or exemption from, a covered regulation applicable to a civilian nuclear power reactor that has permanently ceased to operate.
Subsection (b) shall not apply to a civilian nuclear power reactor described in that subsection at which all spent nuclear fuel has been transferred to spent nuclear fuel dry casks.
